thread.title: Bulletin Board for Oct. 23
thread.title_full: Bulletin Board for Oct. 23 - Sports - The Buffalo News

author: buffalonews
title: Bulletin Board for Oct. 23
text:
BASKETBALL: Tuesday men’s league is forming. No league fees. Call 444-4906.
FLAG FOOTBALL: Sahlen Sports Park is looking for teams to compete in its Friday flag football leagues. For more information, visit SahlenSportsPark.com or call Andy at (716) 655-7529 ext. 106. Men’s and coed leagues are forming. Call 444-4906.
HOCKEY: The Buffalo Stars Youth Hockey Association in conjunction with USA Hockey will offer a Try Hockey Free Day on Saturday, Nov. 7 for boys and girls ages 4-9. The on-ice session will take place at 1:30 p.m. at Holiday Twin Rinks in Cheektowaga. Register online at www.tryhockeyforfree.com . For more information, call 491-0375 or visit www.buffalostars.com .
ICE SKATING: Learn to skate classes for hockey players and figure skaters will be starting the week of Nov. 16. Classes will be held at the Niagara University’s Dwyer Arena in Lewiston on Mondays (5:15-5:45 p.m.), Wednesdays (6-6:30 p.m.) and Fridays (4:55-5:25 p.m.) and at Hockey Outlet in Wheatfield on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 4:30-5 p.m. Classes are for ages 4 to adult. Download an application or sign up and pay online at www.mitchellskating.com . For more information call 636-7401.
KICKBALL: Thursday coed indoor six-player league is forming. No league fee. Call 444-4906.
RUNNING: The Buffalo Philharmonic AC will be dedicating a bench in honor of the late Jesse Kregal, the founder of the club, on Saturday. A ceremony will be held at the bench, which will be located on the ring road about 100 yards north of “The Meadow Cafe.” It will begin at 11:30 a.m. A reception will be held at the Lodge in the park near Parkside Ave. following the ceremony.
SOCCER: The Hamburg Monarchs soccer club will be conducting registration for its indoor house league running from November 2015 through March 2016. Four age group leagues (4-year olds, 6-and-under, 8-and-under, and 10-and-under) will be formed. Registration will be available online at www.hamburgsoccerclub.com . Training will take place at Armor Elementary, 5301 Abbott Road, Hamburg. No prior soccer experience is required. ... Sahlen Sports Park is looking for teams to compete in its Sunday Men’s 11v11 soccer and Monday women’s soccer leagues. For more information, visit SahlenSportsPark.com or call Andy at (716) 655-7529 ext. 106.
SOFTBALL: The Amherst Lightning 14U Reid Showcase Travel Team is looking for an ‘01 utility 2B/3B or possible pitcher for a high level travel showcase team. Tournaments include travel to 3-4 out of state showcase tourneys as well as 8-10 local tournaments. If interested please contact coaches Rob Reid at (716) 880-0597 or Mark DiPirro at (716) 479-1569.
SWIMMING: St. Francis High School has an immediate opening for a swim coach for the 2015-16 winter season. Please contact the St. Francis High School Athletic Department at 627-2359 if interested.
The Bulletin Board appears Tuesday and Friday. Information must be submitted by mail (c/o Buffalo News, Sports Dept., One News Plaza, Buffalo, NY 14240) or email ( sports@buffnews.com ). There is no charge.
